title: New preprint
text: We have published a new preprint, first-authored by Chundra Cathcart from the University of Zurich and in collaboration with many colleagues from our chair in Passau. The study titled "How communicatively optimal are exact numeral systems? Once more on lexicon size and morphosyntactic complexity" is now available on arXiv.

title: New preprint
text: I have published a new preprint in collaboration with Tihomir Rangelov, Luca Ciucci, John Burgess, Riccardo Rost & Johann-Mattis List. The study titled "Integration of Linguistic Legacy Data Collections through Digital Scholarly Editions: A Case Study on Vanuatu Languages" is now available on Humanities Commons.

title: Three papers accepted
text: Very happy to announce that our paper “Partial Colexifications Improve Concept Embeddings” (with Johann-Mattis List) has been accepted for the main conference of the Association for Computational Linguistics. Two more papers that I have co-authored were accepted to SIGTYP: "Annotating and Inferring Compositional Structures in Numeral Systems Across Languages" (with myself as first author) and "Unstable Grounds for Beautiful Trees? Testing the Robustness of Concept Translations in the Compilation of Multilingual Wordlists" (first-authored by my colleague David Snee).
